text.text_translated: Asteroids are big rocks in space. Some asteroids can be dangerous to Earth. They are called 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids' (PHAs). They fly very close to Earth. This is less than 7.5 million kilometres away. NASA made a map of 1,400 PHAs. None of them is a danger for the next 100 years. NASA has technology now. It can follow these rocks. It can say if a rock is going to hit Earth. If a rock becomes a danger, NASA has two plans to keep us safe.

All complex vocabulary from the original text ('potentially', 'orbit', 'threat', 'predictions', 'impact', 'defence solutions') has been expertly replaced with simple A1/A2 equivalents ('can be', 'fly very close', 'danger', 'say if', 'hit', 'plans to keep us safe'). Sentence structures are simple, declarative, and immediately understandable. Factual accuracy is perfectly maintained. No corrections are necessary.
